intro: Hieracium oblanceolatum, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium oblanceolatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
